title: Acyclic Coloring
content: A proper vertex coloring where no cycle uses only two colors. This is stronger than ordinary proper coloring.

title: Function f(d)
content: f(d) = maximum acyclic chromatic number over all graphs with maximum degree at most d.

title: Greedy Upper Bound
content: f(d) ≤ d² + 1 by greedy coloring. This is the trivial bound that was improved.

title: Erdős Lower Bound
content: f(d) ≥ d^{4/3 - o(1)}. This established the correct order of magnitude from below.

title: Alon-McDiarmid-Reed Upper Bound
content: f(d) ≤ O(d^{4/3}). This matching upper bound was the key breakthrough, using the Lovász Local Lemma.

title: Why Exponent 4/3
content: With k colors, expected bichromatic 4-cycles ≈ n·d²/k². Balancing constraints gives k ≈ d^{4/3}.

title: Main Answer: f(d) = o(d²)
content: YES, f(d) = o(d²) since f(d) = Θ(d^{4/3}) and d^{4/3}/d² = d^{-2/3} → 0.

title: Four-Cycles are Critical
content: The main obstacle is avoiding bichromatic 4-cycles. Longer cycles are easier to handle with careful coloring.

title: Complete Characterization
content: f(d) = o(d²) and more precisely f(d) = Θ(d^{4/3}) with a (log d)^{1/3} gap between upper and lower bounds.
